citation.name: Cell Rep.
citation.title: An organellar nalpha-acetyltransferase, naa60, acetylates cytosolic N termini of transmembrane proteins and maintains Golgi integrity.

comment.text: Interacts with dystrophin short form DP71 and syntrophins SNTG1 and SNTG2. Binds dystrobrevin binding protein 1 (By similarity).
Highly expressed in brain, kidney and pancreas.
The coiled coil domain may mediate the interaction with dystrophin.
May be produced at very low levels due to a premature stop codon in the mRNA, leading to nonsense-mediated mRNA decay.
Belongs to the dystrophin family. Dystrobrevin subfamily.

property.value: Expressed in C1 segment of cervical spinal cord and 163 other tissues
